page.title: 17Two Farms near Maresfield.
page.content: Mr and Mrs Cornwell own Marshalls Farm.It is near Maresfield wood,south of Picketts Lane.They have beef cattle which they feed with grass in summer,hay in winter.They sell most of their meat but eat some.They belong to the National Farmers Union.They grow about 2 acres of potatoes as well as wheat and barley.They have a combine harvester,a tractor,a bailer and a potato harvester. Kingsfield Farm is a pig,sheep and poultry farm 1 mile north of Maresfield owned by the farmer Mr Cottingham.He works 14 - 15 hours a day.They have 100 pigs and 4000 chickens,450 sheep in summer.They produce pork eggs and lamb. He has two workers and his wife helps. by Adele, Elizabeth and Helen.
